result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher M. Richardson
Current: 1321 W Walnut Dr, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 11-19-2015)
Prior: 1321 W Walnut Dr, Sturgoen Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Christopher M. Richardson in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises of offer made to Defendant, advises that Defendant wants to accept jail option. Court questions Defendant, who agrees. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State makes sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Christopher M. Richardson in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.

No violent contact with CB. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Christopher M. Richardson appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/23/15, 10:00.
